text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Lao Tzu

text: We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
author: Orson Welles

text: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
author: Mother Teresa

text: You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
author: Buddha

text: Time is too slow for those who wait, too swift for those who fear, too long for those who grieve, too short for those who rejoice, but for those who love, time is eternity.
author: Henry Van Dyke

text: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

text: I feel that there is nothing more truly artistic than to love people.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

text: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: True love is like ghosts, which everyone talks about and few have seen.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

text: Where there is love there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: You can't blame gravity for falling in love.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

text: Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them humanity cannot survive.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Choose your love, Love your choice.
author: Thomas S. Monson

text: Love is the only reality and it is not a mere sentiment. It is the ultimate truth that lies at the heart of creation.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

text: Love is energy of life.
author: Robert Browning

text: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
author: David Viscott

text: For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love.
author: Carl Sagan

text: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
author: Lucille Ball

text: Love doesn't make the world go 'round. Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.
author: Franklin P. Jones

text: True love is eternal, infinite, and always like itself. It is equal and pure, without violent demonstrations: it is seen with white hairs and is always young in the heart.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: One does not fall in love; one grows into love, and love grows in him.
author: Karl A. Menninger

text: Love is the flower you've got to let grow.
author: John Lennon

text: True love cannot be found where it does not exist, nor can it be denied where it does.
author: Torquato Tasso

text: What we have once enjoyed we can never lose. All that we love deeply becomes a part of us.
author: Helen Keller

text: Immature love says: 'I love you because I need you.' Mature love says 'I need you because I love you'.
author: Erich Fromm

text: Love isn't something you find. Love is something that finds you.
author: Loretta Young

text: Love is like war: easy to begin but very hard to stop.
author: H. L. Mencken

text: Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit.
author: Peter Ustinov

text: Love can be unselfish, in the sense of being benevolent and generous, without being selfless.
author: Mortimer Adler

text: Love is an energy which exists of itself. It is its own value.
author: Thornton Wilder

text: Faith makes all things possible... love makes all things easy. Dwight L. Moody
author: Dwight L.M00dy

text: When love is at its best, one loves so much that he cannot forget.
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

text: A flower cannot blossom without sunshine, and man cannot live without love.
author: Max Mulle

text: Love has no age, no limit; and no death.
author: John Galsworthy

text: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.
author: Voltaire

text: Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.
author: Robert Frost

text: We loved with a love that was more than love.
author: Edgar Allan Po

text: To say 'I love you' one must first be able to say the 'I.'
author: Ayn Rand

text: A kiss is a lovely trick designed by nature to stop speech when words become superfluous.
author: Ingrid Bergman

text: Love can sometimes be magic. But magic can sometimes... just be an illusion.
author: Javan

text: The best proof of love is trust.
author: Joyce Brothers

text: Love is a friendship set to music.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Come live in my heart, and pay no rent.
author: Samuel Lover

text: Love is always bestowed as a gift - freely, willingly and without expectation. We don't love to be loved; we love to love.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: When love is not madness, it is not love.
author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

text: We can only learn to love by loving.
author: Iris Murdoch

text: One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: You can give without loving, but you can never love without giving.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: Don't forget to love yourself.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

text: The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

text: People protect what they love.
author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

text: Love knows not distance; it hath no continent; its eyes are for the stars.
author: Gilbert Parker

text: Don't threaten me with love, baby. Let's just go walking in the rain.
author: Billie Holiday

text: Your words are my food, your breath my wine. You are everything to me.
author: Sarah Bernhardt

text: Friendship often ends in love; but love in friendship - never.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

text: Absence sharpens love, presence strengthens it.
author: Thomas Fuller

text: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
author: Charles Dickens

text: I can live without money, but I cannot live without love.
author: Judy Garland

text: Only do what your heart tells you.
author: Princess Diana

text: Love you will find only where you may show yourself weak without provoking strength.
author: Theodor W. Adorno

text: Love is a game that two can play and both win.
author: Eva Gabor

text: We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love.
author: Tom Robbins

text: True love comes quietly, without banners or flashing lights. If you hear bells, get your ears checked.
author: Erich Segal

text: Love is space and time measured by the heart.
author: Marcel Proust

text: Love in its essence is spiritual fire.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: There is always something left to love. And if you ain't learned that, you ain't learned nothing.
author: Lorraine Hansberry

text: A man is already halfway in love with any woman who listens to him.
author: Brendan Behan

text: The fate of love is that it always seems too little or too much.
author: Amelia Barr

text: The giving of love is an education in itself.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The art of love is largely the art of persistence.
author: Albert Ellis

text: In our life there is a single color, as on an artist's palette, which provides the meaning of life and art. It is the color of love.
author: Marc Chagall

text: Love, having no geography, knows no boundaries.
author: Truman Capote

text: A loving heart is the beginning of all knowledge.
author: Thomas Carlyle

text: A part of kindness consists in loving people more than they deserve.
author: Joseph Joubert

text: Love is never wrong.
author: Melissa Etheridge

text: stolen kisses are always sweetest.
author: Leigh Hunt

text: You learn to speak by speaking, to study by studying, to run by running, to work by working; in just the same way, you learn to love by loving.
author: Anatole France

text: Be of love a little more careful than of anything.
author: e. e. cummings

text: In a full heart there is room for everything, and in an empty heart there is room for nothing.
author: Antonio Porchia

text: To love is to admire with the heart; to admire is to love with the mind.
author: Theophile Gautier

text: Love is being stupid together.
author: Paul Valery

text: Love is not only something you feel, it is something you do.
author: David Wilkerson

text: Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same.
author: Emily Bronte

text: It is sad not to love, but it is much sadder not to be able to love.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

text: The love of liberty is the love of others; the love of power is the love of ourselves.
author: William Hazlitt

text: If you can learn to love yourself and all the flaws, you can love other people so much better. And that makes you so happy.
author: Kristin Chenoweth

text: The first duty of love is to listen.
author: Paul Tillich

text: Love is the magician that pulls man out of his own hat.
author: Ben Hecht

text: There is no person that love cannot heal; there is no soul that love cannot save.
author: Carlos Santana

text: We are all born for love. It is the principle of existence, and its only end.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

text: Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

text: To love abundantly is to live abundantly, and to love forever is to live forever.
author: Henry Drummond

text: We love because it's the only true adventure.
author: Nikki Giovanni

text: With our love, we could save the world.
author: George Harrison

text: Self-love is the source of all our other loves.
author: Pierre Corneille

text: Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold.
author: Zelda Fitzgerald_

text: Love is what you've been through with somebody.
author: James Thurber

text: ove is the ultimate expression of the will to live.
author: Tom Wolfe

text: There's no bad consequence to loving fully, with all your heart. You always gain by giving love.
author: Reese Witherspoon

text: Love is supreme and unconditional; like is nice but limited.
author: Duke Ellington

text: Suffering passes, while love is eternal. That's a gift that you have received from God. Don't waste it.
author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

text: Loving others always costs us something and requires effort. And you have to decide to do it on purpose. You can't wait for a feeling to motivate you.
author: Joyce Meyer

text: I love that feeling of being in love, the effect of having butterflies when you wake up in the morning. That is special.
author: Jennifer Aniston

text: The sweetest of all sounds is that of the voice of the woman we love.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

text: Love is the hardest habit to break, and the most difficult to satisfy.
author: Drew Barrymore

text: Love is a great beautifier.
author: Louisa May Alcott

text: The way to know life is to love many things.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

text: Great thoughts come from the heart.
author: Luc de Clapiers

text: There is no limit to the power of loving.
author: John Morton

text: Love is the poetry of the senses.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: Familiar acts are beautiful through love.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

text: If it is your time, love will track you down like a cruise missile.
author: Lynda Barry

text: People think love is an emotion. Love is good sense.
author: Ken Kesey

text: If you wish to be loved, show more of your faults than your virtues.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

text: Love is the great miracle cure. Loving ourselves works miracles in our lives.
author: Louise L. Hay

text: Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence.
author: David Byrne

text: Love comes unseen; we only see it go.
author: Henry Austin Dobson

text: Falling in love consists merely in uncorking the imagination and bottling the common sense.
author: Helen Rowland

text: We may give without loving, but we cannot love without giving.
author: Bernard Meltzer

text: For above all things Love means sweetness, and truth, and measure; yea, loyalty to the loved one and to your word. And because of this I dare not meddle with so high a matter.
author: Marie de France

text: When you're in love you never really know whether your elation comes from the qualities of the one you love, or if it attributes them to her; whether the light which surrounds her like a halo comes from you, from her, or from the meeting of your sparks.
author: Natalie Clifford Barney

text: We don't believe in rheumatism and true love until after the first attack.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

text: Love is a mutual self-giving which ends in self-recovery Fulton J Sheen Read more at https://www.brainyquote.com/topics/love-quotes_4
The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Our first and last love is self-love.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

text: The degree of loving is measured by the degree of giving.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

text: At the touch of love everyone becomes a poet.
author: Plato

text: Each moment of a happy lover's hour is worth an age of dull and common life.
author: Aphra Behn

text: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
author: Lao Tzu

text: We are born of love; Love is our mother.
author: Rumi

text: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
author: James Baldwin

text: Love is life. And if you miss love, you miss life.
author: Leo Buscaglia

text: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Love is... never asking for more than you are prepared to give.
author: Kim Casali

text: If your heart is a volcano, how shall you expect flowers to bloom?
author: Khalil Gibran

text: Love is like a beautiful flower which I may not touch, but whose fragrance makes the garden a place of delight just the same.
author: Helen Keller

text: It is difficult to know at what moment love begins; it is less difficult to know that it has begun.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

text: Love is when the other person's happiness is more important than your own.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr

text: Touch seems to be as essential as sunlight.
author: Diane Ackerman

text: Love has reasons which reason cannot understand.
author: Blaise Pascal

text: Love is the only gold.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

text: A very small degree of hope is sufficient to cause the birth of love.
author: Stendhal

text: If you want to be loved, be lovable.
author: Ovid

text: Love is a springtime plant that perfumes everything with its hope, even the ruins to which it clings.
author: Gustave Flaubert

text: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.
author: Burce Lee

text: We love life, not because we are used to living but because we are used to .
author: Friedrich Nietzscheloving

text: Say what you will, 'tis better to be left than never to have been loved.
author: William Congreve

text: The love we give away is the only love we keep.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Love consists in this, that two solitudes protect and touch and greet each other.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

text: Love without conversation is impossible.
author: Mortimer Adler

text: Love is, above all, the gift of oneself.
author: Jean Anouilh
